comments.text:
This is presumably related to bug 227632 in some fashion, and I haven't looked too closely at the code involved.  I've got an old @mozilla.com login stored for the self-serve api, but it no longer works, and my LDAP credentials are for my bugzilla email.  However, whenever I visit the self-serve page, I'm always presented with my mozilla.com login, presumably because of:

http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/toolkit/components/passwordmgr/nsLoginManagerPrompter.js#389

Couldn't we simply default to the entry with the most recent timeLastUsed, which appears to exist at:

http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/toolkit/components/passwordmgr/storage-mozStorage.js#619

That would sidestep the problem wonderfully in my case without having to go digging into the saved passwords.
